countries.name: Nigeria
facts: Nigeria is Africa's most populous country
Home to over 250 ethnic groups
Nollywood is the world's second-largest film industry by volume
The Igbo, Yoruba, and Hausa are the three largest ethnic groups

countries.name: Ghana
facts: First sub-Saharan African country to gain independence (1957)
Known as the 'Gateway to Africa' for diaspora return
Home to the Ashanti Kingdom, one of Africa's most powerful historical empires
The 'Year of Return' in 2019 welcomed diaspora members home

countries.name: Ethiopia
facts: Never colonized by European powers
Home to the oldest Christian church in Africa
Birthplace of coffee
Has its own unique calendar, 7-8 years behind the Gregorian calendar

countries.name: Kenya
facts: Barack Obama's father was from Kenya
Home to the Maasai Mara, one of the world's most famous wildlife reserves
Kenyan runners dominate long-distance running globally
Nairobi is known as the 'Safari Capital of the World'

countries.name: South Africa
facts: Has 11 official languages
Nelson Mandela led the fight against apartheid
Home to the world's deepest gold mine
The Cradle of Humankind contains some of the oldest human fossils

countries.name: Senegal
facts: Gorée Island was a major slave trading post
Known for its vibrant music scene, especially Mbalax
Home to the African Renaissance Monument, the tallest statue in Africa
Dakar Rally originally ended here

countries.name: Egypt
facts: Home to one of the world's oldest civilizations
The Great Pyramid of Giza is the only remaining ancient wonder
Cleopatra lived closer in time to the Moon landing than to the building of the pyramids
The Nile is the longest river in Africa

countries.name: Jamaica
facts: Birthplace of reggae music and Bob Marley
Home to the fastest humans on Earth (Usain Bolt)
Rastafari movement originated here
One of the highest number of churches per square mile

countries.name: Brazil
facts: Largest African diaspora population outside Africa
Salvador, Bahia has the largest Black population of any city outside Africa
Capoeira is an Afro-Brazilian martial art developed by enslaved Africans
Samba and many Brazilian cultural elements have African roots

countries.name: United States
facts: African Americans have shaped every aspect of American culture
The Civil Rights Movement transformed American society
Black History Month was established in 1976
Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs) are cultural institutions

countries.name: United Kingdom
facts: Windrush generation arrived from the Caribbean starting in 1948
Notting Hill Carnival is Europe's largest street festival
Black Britons have contributed significantly to music, arts, and sports
Brixton and Peckham are known for their vibrant Afro-Caribbean communities

countries.name: Haiti
facts: First free Black republic in the world (1804)
Only successful slave revolution in history
Vodou originated from West African spiritual traditions
Paid 'reparations' to France until 1947 for their freedom
